item.title: 印度小型股股价接近纪录，美联储前景受关注
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 大和计划进军澳大利亚农场贷款和房地产领域
item.description: 大和证券集团公司（Daiwa Securities Group Inc.【原文：Daiwa Securities Group Inc. is eyeing Australia for its first expansion into the agricultural sector abroad, part of a wider push to boost lending and direct investment in the country’s real estate and renewable energy sectors.】

item.title: 中国公布打压债券措施细节，为多头带来些许安慰
item.description: 中国监管机构的一位高级官员表示，中国政府将继续打击较长期限债券的投机性交易，但他同时表示，中国官员并不像某些人猜测的那样试图控制收益率。【原文：A senior official at a Chinese regulatory body said Beijing will keep cracking down on speculative trading in longer-dated bonds, though suggested officials are not seeking to control yields as some suspected.】

item.title: Binance 裁员 1000 人，合规支出突破 2 亿美元
item.description: Binance Holdings Ltd. 今年将招聘 1000 名员工，其中许多人将专门负责合规工作，因为这家加密货币交易所每年为满足监管要求（包括美国根据认罪协议进行的监管）而支出的费用高达 2 亿美元。【原文：Binance Holdings Ltd. is hiring 1,000 people this year with many earmarked for compliance roles as the crypto exchange’s annual spending to meet regulatory requirements, including US oversight under a plea deal, tops $200 million.】

item.title: 中国银行成为疯狂追逐收益率的意外赢家
item.description: 随着中国经济的挣扎和房地产危机的恶化，这里可以说是股票投资者最不愿意去的地方之一。【原文：It’s arguably one of the last places you’d expect stock investors to turn as China’s economy struggles and its real estate crisis worsens.】

item.title: 中国股市第三年创下退市纪录
item.description: 受过去十年首次公开募股（IPO）数量激增以及为淘汰弱小公司而出台的更严格规定的推动，中国股市将连续第三年创下退市纪录。【原文：China’s stock markets are set for a third straight year of record delistings driven by the jump in IPOs over the past decade and tighter rules introduced to weed out weaker members.】

item.title: 低税是印度的诱惑，绿色债务错失国家债券热潮
item.description: 印度正在做出新的努力，以激发人们对其绿色债券的兴趣，因为该类别债券错失了外国资金流入当地主权债券的洪流。【原文：India is making new efforts to ignite interest in its green debt as the category misses out on a torrent of foreign flows into local sovereign bonds.】

item.title: 马来西亚债券将从国债反弹中获得亚洲新兴市场最大收益
item.description: 新兴亚洲债券对国债的敏感度正在向 2024 年的峰值回升，马来西亚的债务将成为最大的受益者。【原文：The sensitivity of emerging Asian bonds to Treasuries is climbing back toward its 2024 peak, with Malaysia’s debt set to be the biggest beneficiary.】

item.title: 澳大利亚股市或将延续2015年以来最长连胜势头
item.description: 澳大利亚股市创下近九年来最长连胜纪录，随着基准指数逼近历史新高，涨势似乎有望继续。【原文：Australian stocks are on their longest winning streak in almost nine years, and the rally appears poised to continue as the benchmark flirts with fresh record high levels.】

item.title: Wamco 长期以来的债券大王被推到了他所回避的聚光灯下
item.description: 三十年来，肯-李奇一直是另一位邦德之王，一位沉默寡言的邦德之王。【原文：For three decades, Ken Leech was the other Bond King, the quiet one.】

item.title: 感染模式复杂多样，麻疹病毒风险增加
item.description: 当疾病检测人员赶赴非洲中部平息如雨后春笋般蔓延的麻风腮疫情时，他们发现了一种复杂的马赛克感染模式，其中涉及不同的病毒株和大相径庭的感染途径。【原文：As disease detectives rush to central Africa to quell a mushrooming mpox contagion, they’re finding a complex mosaic of infection patterns involving different viral strains and vastly different routes of infection.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。澳大利亚央行努力以鹰派信息说服市场。福特再次调整电动汽车战略。詹姆斯-戈尔曼（James Gorman）将领导迪士尼首席执行官继任者的物色工作。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Australia’s central bank struggles to persuade markets with hawkish message. Ford recalibrates EV strategy yet again. James Gorman will lead Disney's CEO successor search. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 需求前景黯淡，原油维持在一月低点附近
item.description: 由于对美国经济放缓可能抑制需求的担忧超过了显示库存减少的数据带来的提振，石油稳定在 1 月份以来的最低点附近。【原文：Oil steadied near the lowest since January as concerns of an economic slowdown in the US that may sap demand outweighed the lift from data showing lower inventories.】

item.title: 日元反弹威胁日本盈利增长
item.description: 日本公司刚刚公布了创纪录的季度利润，但日元的反弹加剧了人们的担忧，在中国需求疲软和美国经济放缓的风险下，日本公司的盈利增长能否持续？【原文：Japanese companies have just posted record quarterly profits, but the yen’s rebound is fueling worries about just how sustainable their earnings growth will be amid weak demand in China and the risk of a slowing US economy.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》称，普华永道预计恒大审计将在中国被禁入六个月
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》报道，普华永道会计师事务所中国分所预计，作为对其审计失败的房地产巨头中国恒大集团的惩罚措施之一，中国政府最早将于下月下达为期六个月的禁令。【原文：PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP’s China unit expects the Chinese government to hand down a six-month ban that will start as early as next month as part of punishment over its audit of failed property giant China Evergrande Group, the Financial Times reported.】

item.title: 韩股牛市寄希望于美联储降息带来复苏
item.description: 韩国多头期待美联储的降息能给韩国股市带来超过亚洲新兴股市的更大推动力。【原文：South Korean bulls are looking to the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cuts to give the country’s stocks a bigger boost over emerging Asian peers.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因美联储鸽派会议纪要而反弹：市场综述
item.description: 周四，有进一步迹象表明美联储将在下个月降息，这提振了华尔街，亚洲股市也随之上涨。【原文：Stocks in Asia were primed for gains Thursday after further signs the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates next month lifted Wall Street.】

item.title: 道明银行受美国调查影响损失 26 亿美元，出售施瓦布股票
item.description: 多伦多道明银行（Toronto-Dominion Bank）正在计提 26 亿美元的准备金，用于支付因洗钱控制失误而预计要支付的罚款，并已出售其在嘉信理财公司（Charles Schwab Corp.【原文：Toronto-Dominion Bank is taking a provision of $2.6 billion for fines it expects to pay for failures in its money-laundering controls, and has sold part of its stake in Charles Schwab Corp. to fund it.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Tribeca 称银行研究不力助其上涨 19
item.description: 澳大利亚业绩排名第二的对冲基金正从盈利季节更大的市场波动中获利，称投资银行的研究未能跟踪发展较快的行业的涨跌。【原文：Australia’s second-best performing hedge fund is profiting from greater market swings during earnings seasons, saying investment bank research has failed to track the ups and downs of faster-evolving industries.】

item.title: Enbridge 首席执行官埃贝尔认为人工智能发电量 "巨大"，美国液化天然气翻番
item.description: Enbridge Inc.首席执行官格雷格-埃贝尔（Greg Ebel）在公司从石油管道运营商转变为业务涉及各种能源形式的庞大企业的过程中发挥了重要作用。【原文：Enbridge Inc. Chief Executive Officer Greg Ebel has played a major role in the company’s transformation from an oil-focused pipeline operator into a sprawling enterprise with businesses touching all forms of energy.】

item.title: 业内人士警告说，铁路罢工将对不列颠哥伦比亚省林业造成沉重打击
item.description: 不列颠哥伦比亚省的林业正在为潜在的铁路罢工所带来的干扰做准备，罢工将迅速削弱这个为加拿大西部经济增加 60 多亿加元（44 亿美元）收入的行业。【原文：British Columbia’s forestry industry is bracing for disruptions from a potential rail strike that would quickly undercut a sector that adds more than C$6 billion ($4.4 billion) to western Canada’s economy.】

item.title: 美国调查 Western Asset 如何为客户账户分配交易
item.description: 纽约联邦检察官正在调查西方资产管理公司（Western Asset Management）的一名高管是否将获胜的交易分配给了偏好的账户，这是对一种被称为 "挑肥拣瘦 "做法的刑事调查的一部分。【原文：Federal prosecutors in New York are investigating whether a Western Asset Management executive allocated winning trades to favored accounts, as part of a criminal probe into a practice known as “cherry-picking.”】

item.title: 银行在报告延迟期间获得关键就业修正数据
item.description: 至少有三家银行设法提前获得了周三备受瞩目的薪资数据，而华尔街其他银行则因意外延迟而翘首以待。【原文：At least three banks managed to get advanced word on Wednesday’s hotly anticipated payroll numbers while the rest of Wall Street was kept waiting by an unexpected delay.】

item.title: 恩桥公司在新的竞争中降低石油管道系统的收费标准
item.description: 由于一条从阿尔伯塔省通往温哥华的新线路的竞争日益激烈，Enbridge Inc.【原文：Enbridge Inc. cut tolls on Canadian oil export pipelines amid increased competition from a new line running from Alberta to Vancouver.】

item.title: 加拿大铁路可能罢工，小麦期货下跌
item.description: 由于加拿大铁路罢工的威胁促使农民在运输中断前出售谷物，小麦价格下跌。【原文：Wheat prices fell as the threat of a rail strike in Canada prompted farmers to sell the grain ahead of any transport disruptions.】

item.title: Ovintiv 探讨出售乌因塔盆地的石油业务
item.description: 知情人士称，Ovintiv 公司正在考虑出售其在乌因塔盆地的业务，出售价格可能高达 20 亿美元。【原文：Ovintiv Inc. is considering a possible sale of its operations in the Uinta Basin, which could fetch as much as $2 billion, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 理想的农作物年对美国玉米种植者来说是逆境
item.description: 蒂姆-戈特沙克（Tim Gottschalk）眼眶湿润，他描述了自己三十年务农生涯中最艰难的一年，面临着农作物价格低、种子和设备成本高以及利率上升的沉重压力。【原文：Tim Gottschalk is misty-eyed as he describes the toughest year in his three decades of farming, facing heavy pressure from low crop prices, high seed and equipment costs and elevated interest rates.】

item.title: 汽油价格跌至 6 个月低点，为民主党带来福音
item.description: 纽约汽油期货跌至六个月来的盘中低点，为美国总统大选前油价下跌奠定了基础。【原文：Gasoline futures in New York tumbled to a six-month intraday low, setting the stage for lower pump prices ahead of the US presidential election.】

item.title: 比索跌势加剧，墨西哥成为交易商的噩梦
item.description: 试图买入墨西哥比索跌势的交易员们无法抓住机会。【原文：Traders trying to buy the dip on Mexico’s peso can’t catch a break.】

item.title: 特鲁多呼吁铁路公司和工会达成协议避免罢工
item.description: 加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）正在敦促加拿大最大的两家铁路公司和工会工人达成协议，避免企业警告将对加拿大和美国经济造成重大损害的罢工。【原文：Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is urging Canada’s two largest railways and unionized workers to reach a deal to avert a strike that businesses warn will cause significant harm to the Canadian and US economies.】
